meanings.definition: Pretend to be someone else for fun or as part of a performance.
meanings.sent1: During the school play, Sarah decided to playact as a princess.
meanings.sent2: The children love to playact different characters when they play together.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Tom tried to playact as a famous movie star, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: She would often playact as a detective, searching for clues in her backyard.
meanings.sent5: The actor's ability to playact various roles impressed the audience.

meanings.sent1: The drama club members playact in the school play every year.
meanings.sent2: Actors and actresses playact on stage to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends decided to playact a scene from their favorite play for fun.
meanings.sent4: The dancers playact their roles with grace and skill during the ballet performance.
meanings.sent5: The theater troupe will playact a classic Shakespearean play next month.

meanings.definition: Pretend to have a particular feeling or attitude.
meanings.sent1: Even though she was upset, Sarah tried to playact happiness at the party.
meanings.sent2: He would playact confidence in front of others, even when he felt nervous inside.
meanings.sent3: The children playacted surprise when they saw the magician perform his tricks.
meanings.sent4: She playacted indifference, but deep down, she cared a lot about the outcome.
meanings.sent5: The politician tried to playact sincerity during his speech, but many could see through it.
